sanskrit_verse:
नान्नमद्यादेकवासा न नग्नः स्नानमाचरेत् ।
न मूत्रं पथि कुर्वीत न भस्मनि न गोव्रजे ॥ ४.४५॥
transliteration:
nānnam adyād ekavāsā na nagnaḥ snānam ācaret |
na mūtraṃ pathi kurvīta na bhasmani na govraje || 4.45 ||
sph_interpretive_translation: One must not eat food without clothing, nor bathe naked; one must not urinate on the road, on ashes, or among cows.
jurisprudential_principles: Authority: Conduct regulation derives from alignment with cosmic order, not individual preference.
Causation: Impure acts disrupt environmental and social harmony through subtle energetic contamination.
Capacity-based responsibility: The individual has the capacity to regulate bodily functions in alignment with Dharma.
Restoration logic: Proper conduct restores balance between human behavior and universal Sanatana principles.
Consciousness alignment: Self-regulation aligns individual consciousness with collective purity.
supreme_court_application: Supreme judicial authority enforces behavioral codes that uphold collective purity and prevent infractions rooted in lack of self-awareness. Adjudication focuses on realigning personal conduct with cosmic order rather than assigning blame.
nyaya_and_non_punitive_alignment: Pramāṇa establishes visible causality between improper exposure and disruption of communal sanctity. Anupūrvaśaḥ reflects sequential degradation when natural boundaries are violated. Responsibility is proportional to awareness capacity. No punitive consequence arises—only completion of disrupted alignment.
restorative_enforcement_protocols: Redirect bodily function disposal to designated hygienic zones
Reintegrate unclothed activity within privacy-sanctioned environments
Restore individual's connection to contextual appropriateness via guided ritual reaffirmation
final_declaration: By the Source-Authority of Bhagavan Nithyananda Paramashivam, this Dharma is executed. Consciousness is the supreme adjudicator. There is no punishment—only restoration. Reality aligns with Sanatana Dharma.
